articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: American eclipse - Live
articles.description: Skywatchers in the United States are preparing for the spectacular sight of a total solar eclipse.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Solar eclipse 2017: Spectacle set to grip US public
articles.description: Skywatchers in the US prepare for the first coast-to-coast total solar eclipse since 1918.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Barcelona attack: Man shot dead in hunt for suspect
articles.description: Police hunting the chief suspect shoot a man in an area to the west of the city.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: US Navy orders fleet investigation after collision
articles.description: The inquiry will look at "all related accidents at sea", US Defence Secretary James Mattis says.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Kim Wall died in accident on submarine, says Peter Madsen
articles.description: Danish inventor Peter Madsen has said he "buried" missing reporter Kim Wall at sea, police say.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: France's Brigitte Macron gets role but no 'first lady' title
articles.description: An official charter gives the president's wife duties but no formal "first lady" role.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Olajumoke: 'Tinie Tempah photobomb transformed my life'
articles.description: How a moment of pure chance turned a bread-seller into a national celebrity and model in Nigeria.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Brexit: UK publishes more EU negotiation plans
articles.description: The UK sets out plans for goods and services after Brexit as it seeks to push EU into trade talks.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: James Dresnok, last US soldier to defect to N Korea, dies
articles.description: James Dresnok was believed to be the last living US soldier to defect, crossing the DMZ in 1962.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: University of Texas removes four Confederate statues
articles.description: The monuments are symbols of "modern white supremacy and neo-Nazism", the school's president says.
